summary: A video guide highlighting common mistakes hikers make on the Tour du Mont Blanc.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, Alette and Deen, sitting on a couch with a green wall behind them, discussing hiking the Tour du Mont Blanc. They are dressed in black, with Alette wearing a black t-shirt and Deen wearing a black cap. The video starts with a title card reading '7 MISTAKES PEOPLE MAKE HIKING THE TMB' in bold yellow and white text. The scene transitions to a picturesque view of hikers walking through a field of yellow flowers with snow-capped mountains in the background, followed by a shot of a hiker in a red jacket and black pants walking on a trail. The video then returns to Alette and Deen, who continue their discussion, with the Instagram handle '@hikaholics_dna' visible in the top left corner. The video concludes with a shot of a hiker in a red jacket and black pants walking through a village with wooden buildings and a sign reading 'LES HOUCES | TOUR DU MONT BLANC.' The video maintains a consistent theme of discussing hiking the Tour du Mont Blanc, with a mix of indoor and outdoor scenes.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with energetic electronic music with a quick tempo and heavy bass, creating a dynamic and exciting atmosphere. A male speaker introduces the topic: mistakes while hiking the Tour de Mont Blanc. This transitions to a woman speaking, welcoming viewers to a hiking video and introducing herself and the male speaker. The man resumes, stating they will discuss the seven mistakes people make when hiking and planning the Tour de Mont Blanc. He encourages listeners to stay until the end, promising a surprising mistake. The music resumes, still energetic but slightly lower in volume, providing a background to the speech. The man mentions they hiked the entire Tour de Mont Blanc and suggests listeners check out their detailed video on YouTube. Finally, the woman signals the start of discussing the seven mistakes.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a scenic view of a mountainous landscape, where two hikers are seen walking along a trail surrounded by lush greenery and towering peaks. The text 'MISTAKE #1' appears prominently, indicating the start of a series highlighting common hiking errors. The scene transitions to an indoor setting where two individuals, one with long hair and the other wearing a cap, are seated on a couch, engaging in a discussion. The Instagram handle '@hikaholics_dna' is visible, suggesting the source of the content. The video then shifts to a misty forest trail, where a group of hikers is seen navigating a rocky path, emphasizing the challenges of hiking in such conditions. The text 'PLAN MONTHS AHEAD' appears, stressing the importance of thorough preparation. The narrative continues with a screenshot of a social media post titled 'Tour Du Mont Blanc,' showcasing a hiker's journey, followed by a return to the indoor discussion, reinforcing the theme of planning and preparation. The video wraps up with the two individuals continuing their conversation, underscoring the significance of planning and avoiding common mistakes in hiking.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a female speaker discussing "mistake number one," which is "not planning ahead." She emphasizes this as the "first and by far biggest mistake" people make before even starting. A male speaker then describes the popularity of the Tour de Mont Blanc trail and the need to plan months in advance. He further explains that there are multiple Facebook groups where people announce when the huts open for bookings, often at the beginning of the year for the upcoming summer. He cautions that even emailing immediately, the huts may already be fully booked by organizations.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They are engaged in a conversation, with the woman gesturing as she speaks. The Instagram handle '@hikaholics_dna' is visible in the top left corner. As the conversation progresses, the woman points to a website displayed on the screen, 'www.montourdumontblanc.com,' which showcases a mountain landscape and information about a hiking route. The man listens attentively, occasionally nodding in agreement. The atmosphere is casual and informative, with the focus on discussing the hiking route and its details.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker describing a website they used for planning a trail, mentioning "Montourde Mont Blanc.com" and promising to put a link in the description box. The speaker speaks in a normal tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They are dressed in casual attire, with the woman in a dark top and the man in a black t-shirt and cap. Throughout the video, they engage in a conversation, with the woman gesturing with her hands and the man occasionally nodding in agreement. The Instagram handle "@hikaholics_dna" is visible in the top left corner of the frames, indicating the source of the content. The setting is simple and cozy, with the focus on the interaction between the two individuals. The video maintains a consistent atmosphere, with no significant changes in the environment or the subjects' actions, emphasizing their dialogue and expressions.
events_list.audio_caption: Two speakers are having a conversation. The first, a man, talks about booking a hike via an organization, which he says helps with the first steps, but doesn't mean you'll be hiking in a group. The other speaker, a woman, responds by talking about camping, wild camping, and campgrounds. Both speak conversationally. The clip ends with the man saying something indecipherable.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They are discussing hiking tips, with the text "Extra tip: Know your pace" appearing on the screen, emphasizing the importance of understanding one's own hiking speed. The man gestures as he speaks, while the woman listens attentively. The scene transitions to an outdoor setting where two hikers are seen walking on a trail surrounded by mountains and wildflowers, with the text "MISTAKE #2 NOT ENOUGH TRAINING" displayed, highlighting a common error in hiking. The video then returns to the indoor setting, where the man continues to speak, and the text "HIKE YOUR OWN HIKE" appears, encouraging individuality in hiking experiences. The video maintains a consistent focus on the individuals and their discussion, interspersed with relevant outdoor scenes and text to reinforce the hiking tips being shared.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker emphasizing the importance of knowing your pace when planning a hike, regardless of whether one is a slow hiker who stops frequently or a trail runner. He stresses the need to avoid comparing oneself to others, encouraging listeners to "hike your own hike and enjoy it." He then transitions to the next point, mistake number two. A different male speaker states "this is an obvious one" the need to train for the TMB.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They are engaged in a conversation, with the woman gesturing expressively while the man listens attentively. The text 'hikaholics_dna' appears in the top left corner, indicating the source or creator of the video. The scene transitions to a cable car moving through a misty mountainous landscape, suggesting a travel or adventure theme. Returning to the indoor setting, the text 'TMB IS A CHALLENGE' appears in bold yellow letters, emphasizing the difficulty of the journey. The woman continues to speak, using hand gestures to emphasize her points, while the man remains composed. The video then shifts to an outdoor setting, showing a close-up of a person tying their hiking shoe, with the text '#NOSPON' in yellow at the bottom right, indicating no sponsorship. The video concludes with the two individuals back on the couch, continuing their discussion, with the woman making a final expressive gesture.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with two speakers, a man and a woman, discussing the challenges people face when hiking the TMB trail. The woman notes that taking cable cars is acceptable but that physical limitations can be a setback. The man emphasizes the trail's difficulty and the importance of physical fitness, advocating for stair climbing, long-distance walking, and hiking in mountains. The woman introduces the next reason people may not finish the TMB: bringing new shoes. She highlights the importance of training with new shoes before the trail. The man recounts how many people they met with blisters who had to quit, underscoring the importance of properly broken-in footwear. The woman mentions the importance of the right fit and gear. She describes their preferred sock and shoe set-up, but reminds the listener to remember that they are experienced hikers and preferences will vary.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They engage in a conversation, with the woman gesturing expressively while the man listens attentively. The scene transitions to an outdoor setting where a hiker navigates a rocky, snow-dusted trail, emphasizing the theme of hiking. The video then returns to the indoor setting, where the woman continues to speak animatedly, and the man occasionally responds. Text overlays appear, such as "MISTAKE #5 PACKING TOO MUCH," indicating a discussion about common hiking errors. The video maintains a consistent focus on the individuals' dialogue and the outdoor hiking context, blending indoor conversation with outdoor adventure.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker introducing the fourth mistake, "you didn't bring your trekking poles," followed by a female speaker sarcastically stating, "trekking poles are lame." The male speaker, acknowledging he also made the same mistake, notes he didn't think he needed trekking poles as he'd never used them before, but adds he begged her for a pole. The female speaker states with the "enormous elevation gain every single day" and a backpack, the knees have to deal with a lot of pressure. She goes on to say at the end of the day, people push up on their knees so they can carry their pack's weight. The male speaker then remarks that trekking poles force you to hike with a straight back and help reduce the force on your knees and feet. A female speaker states they are going to move to mistake number five: "packing way too much." She emphasizes that more weight in your backpack makes the trail harder. A song, upbeat and energetic, plays with a prominent brass instrument and a pop-like rhythm. Then the male speaker says, "baby it's a no-brainer."

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a scene of a man sitting on a director's chair in a studio setting, surrounded by crew members and equipment, with bright lights illuminating the area. The text at the bottom of the screen reads "Source: DJ Khaled - No Brainer (Official Video) ft. Justin Bieber Chance The Rapper Guavo," indicating the video is related to a music video. The scene transitions to two individuals sitting on a couch against a plain green wall, with the Instagram handle "@hikaholics.dna" visible in the top left corner. The woman on the left has long hair and wears a black shirt, while the man on the right wears a black cap and a black shirt. They appear to be engaged in a conversation, with the woman gesturing with her hands and the man occasionally responding. The video then shifts to a scenic view of a mountainous landscape with the text "MISTAKE #6 DEHYDRATION" overlaid, suggesting a discussion about common hiking mistakes. The video returns to the two individuals on the couch, continuing their conversation, with the woman gesturing and the man listening attentively. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere throughout, focusing on the discussion between the two individuals.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with upbeat, rhythmic music, possibly pop or electronic, creating a lively mood. This music transitions into a segment of speech with two speakers, one male and one female. The female speaker introduces a topic related to a video about packing for a TMB (Tour du Mont Blanc) event, mentioning their base weight and a booklet. The male speaker adds details about choices regarding clothes, books, and food, emphasizing the benefit of packing less. The female speaker then introduces "mistake number six," while the male speaker clarifies that they're not medical professionals and are only sharing their personal opinions and research.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long, wavy hair and a man wearing a black cap, seated side by side on a couch against a plain green wall. The woman is dressed in a dark blue t-shirt, while the man wears a black t-shirt. They are positioned in front of a couch adorned with orange and yellow cushions. Throughout the video, the woman speaks and gestures with her hands, while the man listens attentively, occasionally nodding in agreement. The Instagram handle "@hikaholics_dna" is visible in the top left corner of the screen. Text overlays appear, including "TAKE YOUR BODY SERIOUSLY" in bold yellow and white letters, emphasizing the importance of physical health. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere, focusing on the conversation between the two individuals.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker advising caution and self-care, stating, "you have to be careful with yourself, take your body seriously," emphasizing the increased physical demands of hiking the TMB. Then, a male speaker elaborates on the harsh sun conditions in high mountains, noting that these factors, combined with physical exertion, "can be much." The overall speaking tone is cautionary and informative. There's no music or background sounds present.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They are dressed in black shirts and appear to be engaged in a conversation. The Instagram handle '@hikaholics_dna' is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The scene transitions to a darkened setting with text overlays providing advice on sun protection and hydration, emphasizing the importance of wearing a cap or hat and drinking enough water. The video then returns to the original setting, where the individuals continue their discussion. Additional text overlays highlight the main purpose of electrolyte drinks, which is to rehydrate. The video maintains a consistent atmosphere, focusing on the individuals' dialogue and the informative text overlays.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker advising how to prepare for hiking, including bringing protection, staying hydrated, and consuming enough sugars and nutritious foods. A female speaker then mentions that electrolytes can be a lifesaver, advising where to buy them. The male speaker elaborates on what electrolytes usually contain, and what their purpose is, revealing that they handed them out on trails due to the presence of dehydrated people.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They are engaged in a discussion about hiking, as indicated by the Instagram handle '@hikaholics.dna' visible in the top left corner. The video transitions to various outdoor scenes of hikers on mountain trails, with text overlays such as 'MISTAKE #7 HIKING UPHILL TOO FAST' and 'FOREVER PACE' emphasizing common hiking errors. The hikers are shown in different settings, including rocky paths and grassy trails, with the sun shining brightly in the sky. The video alternates between the two individuals on the couch and the outdoor hiking scenes, suggesting a mix of personal commentary and practical advice. An emoji with a distressed expression appears on the screen, possibly to highlight the challenges of hiking. The overall atmosphere is informative and engaging, aimed at providing insights into hiking experiences and tips.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features two speakers, a man and a woman, discussing hiking mistakes. The woman introduces mistake number seven, "hiking uphill too fast", or what they call "your forever pace". The man chimes in, explaining "forever pace" is the ideal speed that allows them to hike for hours without needing to catch their breath, but that uphill pace is slower than downhill. The woman adds that they were "literally yo-yoing" with other hikers who were out of breath, while they had energy to continue. The man describes other hikers who were "so tired they probably died inside" and were considering quitting because they didn't enjoy the trail.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They are dressed in black shirts, and the woman has a tattoo on her arm. The video begins with a warning message in bold yellow and white text stating, "IF YOU GO FASTER THAN YOU CAN, YOU ARE MORE LIKELY TO GET INJURED," emphasizing the importance of pacing oneself to avoid injury. The Instagram handle "@hikaholics_dna" is visible in the top left corner throughout the video. The woman gestures with her hands while speaking, and the man listens attentively. The video transitions to a message in bold white and yellow text, "HIKE AT YOUR OWN PACE," reinforcing the theme of personal responsibility in hiking. The woman claps her hands at the end, indicating a positive or encouraging conclusion to the discussion. The overall atmosphere is informative and supportive, with a focus on safety and personal well-being in outdoor activities.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker advising that going faster than one can makes one more likely to get injured. A female speaker follows, discussing the likelihood of slipping and falling when tired and not paying attention while sprinting. Then, the male speaker cautions against being rushed by others, advising hiking at one's own pace. Finally, the female speaker announces that these were the seven mistakes people make while hiking the Tour du Mont Blanc. The speakers sound conversational and informative.

events_list.video_caption: The video features two individuals, a woman with long hair and a man wearing a cap, seated on a couch with a green wall and colorful cushions in the background. They are engaged in a conversation, with the woman gesturing with her hands and the man occasionally responding. The text 'DID YOU MAKE A' appears on the screen, followed by 'LINK IN DESCRIPTION' with an arrow pointing downwards, indicating viewers to check the video description for more information. A Patreon button for 'Hikaholics' is also displayed, suggesting a call to action for viewers to support the channel. The video concludes with a white screen displaying 'Subscribe to our channel' with an arrow pointing upwards, encouraging viewers to subscribe to the channel. Throughout the video, the Instagram handle '@hikaholics_dna' is visible in the top left corner, indicating the social media presence of the channel.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with two speakers, a woman and a man, speaking in an energetic tone and emphasizing the importance of viewer engagement. The woman requests that viewers share their experiences in the comments. The man discusses a platform where viewers can ask questions and participate in virtual gear check-ins. The woman emphasizes the importance of viewer support for content creation. The man transitions to concluding the video, expressing hope that viewers learned something and requesting a mountain emoji from dedicated viewers. Both speakers wish the audience goodbye. Soft, mellow music plays in the background.
